title: MUSA 5080 Portfolio
text:
This portfolio documents my learning journey in Public Policy Analytics (MUSA 5080).


Advanced spatial analysis and data science for urban planning and public policy.




Weekly Notes: My learning reflections and key concepts
Labs: Completed assignments and analyses
Final Project: Capstone modeling challenge




I am Sihan Yu, a recent Geoscience graduate from the University of Edinburgh, where I completed my BSc in Geology and Physical Geography. My studies focused on applying GIS, statistical analysis, and data-driven modeling to understand and manage natural hazards under the impacts of climate change. I am passionate about leveraging geospatial analytics and quantitative methods to address environmental challenges and improve hazard risk management.




Email: [yusihan@upenn.edu]
GitHub: [@sihan-yu429]

title: Week 1 Notes - Course Introduction
text: Git is a version control system and GitHub is the cloud hosting of Git repositories. -key concept in GitHub Repository (repo): Folder containing your project files Commit: Snapshot of your work at a point in time Push: Send your changes to GitHub cloud Pull: Get latest changes from GitHub cloud

title: Week 1 Notes - Course Introduction
text: Git is a version control system and GitHub is the cloud hosting of Git repositories. -key concept in GitHub Repository (repo): Folder containing your project files Commit: Snapshot of your work at a point in time Push: Send your changes to GitHub cloud Pull: Get latest changes from GitHub cloud

title: Week 1 Notes - Course Introduction
text:
Coding Techniques

[New R functions or approaches] Tidyverse packages - table-> tibbles library(tidyverse) to install Read in the tibbles: Car_data <- read_csv(weara.csv) glimpse(car_data) Select <- (name of the data, the column name, column2) resign filter(fga) - not be saved Old_cars <- filter(car_data, oldcars == ‘old’)
us & for multi conditions- and; | for or mutate(name of the data, new column name = prices/1000) add to table Data_name <- rename(data_name, new name = ‘old name’) rename column Single quote if the old name contain space new_data <- select(new_data, -select) remove column In the new name area: Oldcars = case_when(age >20~“old”, TRUE ~ “not old”) recode variables Group by and summarize always go together Avg_manufacturer <- car_data %>% group_by (manufacturer)%>%summarize(ave_price = mean(price)) %>% pipelines connect the codes
[Quarto features learned] Quarto is a publishing system combines code, text, output
